message:
I have lived this. My daughter identified as a boy, verbally stating """"I am a boy"""" when she was four years old. When We met strangers they would ask what my """"son's"""" name was. Waiters would ask what the """"young man"""" would like to eat. I observed and knew that
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
well adjusted and at peace. Such courage he showed and such support he received. I grieve for those that don't have the societal, familial and financial support to become who they truly are. Nobody has the right to define who you are. To do otherwise is an act of violence.
